Documents Application

Database models for the documents application.

This module defines models for handling user documents, including invoices stored as PDF files.

class documents.models.DocumentKind(*values)[source]

Bases : TextChoices

Enumeration of document types.

FACTURE

Represents an invoice document (verbose name: « Facture »).

Type:

str

FACTURE = 'FACTURE'
class documents.models.Document(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases : Model

Model representing a stored document.

user

The user who owns the document.

Type:

ForeignKey

kind

The type of document (e.g., FACTURE).

Type:

CharField

title

The human-readable title of the document.

Type:

CharField

file

The uploaded file path for the document.

Type:

FileField

created_at

Timestamp when the document was created.

Type:

DateTimeField

invoice

Optional link to an Invoice when the document represents a billing invoice.

Type:

OneToOneField

user

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

kind

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

title

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

file

The descriptor for the file attribute on the model instance. Return a FieldFile when accessed so you can write code like:

>>> from myapp.models import MyModel
>>> instance = MyModel.objects.get(pk=1)
>>> instance.file.size

Assign a file object on assignment so you can do:

>>> with open('/path/to/hello.world') as f:
...     instance.file = File(f)
created_at

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

invoice

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

Restaurant.place is a ForwardOneToOneDescriptor instance.

user_id

Views for the documents application.

This module defines class-based views for listing documents, including all documents of a user and invoices specifically.

class documents.views.DocumentListView(**kwargs)[source]

Bases : LoginRequiredMixin, ListView

View for listing all documents of the authenticated user.

Requires login and restricts results to the current user’s documents.

template_name = 'documents/document_list.html'
context_object_name = 'documents'
get_queryset()[source]

Return the queryset of documents for the current user.

Renvoie:

All Document instances belonging to the authenticated user.

Type renvoyé:

QuerySet

class documents.views.InvoiceListView(**kwargs)[source]

Bases : LoginRequiredMixin, ListView

View for listing only invoice documents of the authenticated user.

Requires login and restricts results to documents of type FACTURE belonging to the current user.

template_name = 'documents/invoice_list.html'
context_object_name = 'documents'
get_queryset()[source]

Return the queryset of invoice documents for the current user.

Renvoie:

All Document instances with kind FACTURE belonging to the authenticated user.

Type renvoyé:

QuerySet

URL configuration for the documents application.

This module defines routes for listing documents, including all documents and invoices specifically.

documents.urls.urlpatterns = [<URLPattern '' [name='list']>, <URLPattern 'factures/' [name='invoices']>]

URL patterns for the documents application

Test suite for the documents application.

This module validates access control for documents, ensuring that users can only see their own documents in the list view.

class documents.tests.DocumentsAccessTest(methodName='runTest')[source]

Bases : TestCase

Test cases for document access control.

Ensures that a user cannot see documents belonging to another user.

setUp()[source]

Prepare test fixtures.

Creates: - Two users (u1, u2). - A child associated with u1. - An activity and enrollment for the child. - An invoice and associated document linked to u1.

test_user_sees_only_own_documents()[source]

Ensure that users cannot see documents belonging to others.

Logs in as u2 and checks that the document created for u1 does not appear in the list view.
